original:
Agribusiness refers to the various businesses involved in the production, processing, and distribution of agricultural products. The term encompasses a wide range of activities, including farming, food processing, distribution, and retailing.

In 2005, Mark R. Edwards and Clifford J. Shultz II from Loyola University Chicago redefined agribusiness to highlight its market-centric approach and innovative strategies aimed at serving consume
